title: What are the best band camp introduction activities? - Quora

response.answer_text: OHHHH! I ADORE band camp!!! Okay, I’ve totally got this one. First, ALWAYS do something to know names. You can go around in a circle and say names and something you like or something about you. If you break into small groups, or sections, you could play two truths and a lie, which is nice. *Do not try that one with full ensemble It won’t work* After knowing everyone’s names, you can play a tag game or a game of charades *also a hard one with full ensemble*. If your leadership is up for something a little louder, the game in which people play rock paper scissors is fun. Each time you win, that person follows you around cheering your name behind you. If you lose, then you and all your followers cheer another person on. It’s a cool way to get some laughs and cement the names. All in all, band camp is supposed to be welcoming and fun. If you have that vibe- the rest will follow. You’re gonna get a bunch of good good kids to deal with here, regardless of whether or not you’re the teacher or a leadership kid. (drum major, woodwind/brass captain) Just have fun with it. The rest will follow. Hope this helped!!! ~Music Paige (Clarinet)
